translation: Sutra of the Revolving Wheel One Fascicle

source_sentence: 于闐三藏尸羅達摩於北庭龍興寺譯
translation: Translated by Śīladharma, Tripiṭaka of Khotan, at Lungxingsi, Northern Court
Thus I've heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在大摩尼金剛寶山峯中。
translation: One time, the Buddha was in the peak of the great maṇi-vajra jewel mountain.
He was with a large assembly of bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告金剛摩尼菩薩言。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Vajrapaṇi Bodhisattva and said.

source_sentence: 佛子若有菩薩求大菩提。
translation: "Son of the Buddha, suppose there's a bodhisattva who seeks great enlightenment.
They want to save all sentient beings.
They have received the bodhisattva precepts of discipline.
After training, he once aroused the mind of great bodhi.
They have great compassion.
They always want to serve all tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 欲廣積集諸大菩薩福德資糧。
translation: He wants to gather in great measure the accumulation of merit of the great bodhisattvas.
They want to realize the Buddha's wisdom.

source_sentence: 欲以無礙等持總持諸解脫門神通遊戲。
translation: They want to use unobstructed equipoise to master the miraculous powers and play of the gate of liberation.
He wants to make space into a great treasury.

source_sentence: 欲令自手似如意寶作是奉施。
translation: I want to make my hand resemble a wish-granting treasure and offer it up in this way.
May it be the wish of all the buddhas and world-honored ones.
All great bodhisattvas who have already abided in the tenth ground.
Those who hold the vajra.
Please remember me.

source_sentence: 弟子某甲已發菩提心未安住正道。
translation: 'A certain disciple has arisen the mind of enlightenment and has yet to settle on the right path.'
Now, I'll maintain my body and mind.
At all times.

source_sentence: 以一切種奉施三世諸佛菩薩。
translation: With all kinds of offerings, I'll present them to the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the three times.
May the Tathāgatas be great sovereign buddhas.
All bodhisattvas who have realized the great earth.
They will take me in.
Make me a great accumulator of merit and wisdom.
My vigor, zeal, and vast mental capacity.
Quiet and collected, my supernormal powers are unimpeded.
The perfection of wisdom will be quickly fulfilled.
Again, he said.
"Only the greatly compassionate one will remember me.

source_sentence: 弟子某甲墮在生死繫以大縛。
translation: A certain disciple has fallen into birth-and-death and is bound by a great fetter.
He's confined to prison and has left the correct path and principles.
He's forced by intense force to afflict enemies.
He has no refuge, no help, no eyes, and no support.
Without a general or guide, he marches down a lonely path.
They're headed for birth-and-death and deviate from the great nirvāṇa.
Following the bad destinies, they'll fall into a dangerous path.
They'll often encounter bad friends when they're headed down the wrong path.
Apart from good friends, they're confused about what's right and wrong.
With benefit and without benefit, there's meaning and without meaning.
They're far removed from good and achieve what's unwholesome.
They always turn their backs on the good and noble buddhas and bodhisattvas.
They are subject to the griefs of birth, old age, illness, and death.
They can't be at ease, have no fear, and are fearless.

source_sentence: 心常散亂闕修寂靜調伏施戒及不放逸。
translation: His mind is always distracted, lacking in the cultivation of tranquility, training, discipline, and nonfrivolity.

source_sentence: 遠離等持總持二門十地法忍。
translation: He's distant from the two aspects of equanimity, the two aspects of maintaining the ten grounds, and the tolerance of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 不能安住甚深般若波羅蜜多及平等性。
translation: They can't abide in the profound perfection of wisdom and equality of nature.
He doesn't cultivate measureless kindness, pity, joy, and equanimity.
He doesn't possess the bodhisattva's three grades of morality.
He's free of the great cognition that's unobstructed and unimpeded.

source_sentence: 不能安住於寂滅因善成立法。
translation: He can't abide in the well-established teaching of the cause of cessation.
He's far from having fearlessness in regard to the power of his supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 不住正念不能成就隨行趣入無忘失法。
translation: Not abiding in right mindfulness, he can't achieve the principle of following and entering without forgetting.
He's deficient in virtues.

source_sentence: 見取疑惑障於通達七等覺支。
translation: Their views, grasping doubts, and confusions hinder their ability to penetrate the seven factors of virtual enlightenment.
They lack the cultivation of the eight noble factors of the path as they really are.
They're oppressed by measureless hundreds of thousands of afflictions.
They're constantly ablaze with the oppression of many sufferings.
Their minds are always discouraged, resentful, and distracted.
It's always compliant with the afflictions.
Please let's hope that all the buddhas and bodhisattvas will help us.
Rely on great compassion to rescue me.
Give me refuge and be my guide.

source_sentence: 唯願令我速得圓滿大正覺路。
translation: May it only cause me to quickly complete the path of the great perfect enlightenment.
great accumulation of enlightenment on the path to bodhi.

source_sentence: 又願令我速得圓滿如來十力四無所畏。
translation: May I also quickly attain the fulfillment of the Tathāgata's ten powers and four forms of fearlessness.
The eighteen distinctive characteristics of the Tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 無礙辯才等持解脫陀羅尼門。
translation: The dhāraṇī gate of unhindered eloquence, equal maintenance, and liberation.
The perfection of merit and supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 又願與我一切成就一切功德。
translation: May I also receive from you all the merits of my endeavors.

source_sentence: 復次為轉廣大供養應作是言。
translation: Furthermore, in order to make vast offerings, you should say this.
"May all the buddhas and world-honored ones.
All the bodhisattvas who have attained great power.
Please remember me.
"My disciple, Mr. A.

source_sentence: 今於一切佛菩薩所轉大恭敬。
translation: Now, I've turned out great respect for all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.
I'll honor and serve them, and I'll offer myself as a sacrifice.

source_sentence: 所有十方諸世界中大莊嚴具。
translation: He owns the great ornaments in the worlds of the ten directions.
They are called various jeweled palaces.
They are adorned with treasures, jeweled trees, and jeweled mountains.
Their thrones are made of jeweled seats, their altars are made of rows of precious treasures, and they're decorated with jeweled canopies, banners, and jewelry.
Their jeweled canopies, jeweled banners, and jeweled jewelry.

source_sentence: 真珠羅網寶器寶聚積寶光焰。
translation: True pearls, woven nets, precious vessels, and jewels accumulate, and their light burns brightly.
Among the continents of treasures are the great maṇi treasures.
They are pure lamp trees, jeweled bells, and tolls.
The mani's radiant, true gold duster.
It's draped and connected with the flowers of the wonderful gold lotus.
Jambudvīpa gold makes their beards [beards].
The gold tree is lined with a variety of jeweled palaces.
Raising clouds of jewels, they rain down drops of treasure.
The halls of the treasury are filled with marvelous maṇi.
Their walls are lined with jeweled rails and shields.
The great wielder of wisdom is delighted with the perfect garden.

source_sentence: 屋宅寶宮殿堂樹林皆可愛樂。
translation: Their houses, mansions, jeweled palaces, halls, and forests are all enjoyable.
Thus, nothing is collected, and nothing is experienced.
I'll dedicate my thoughts to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 於贍部洲所有妙藥長壽藥類。
translation: 'Among the wonderful medicines on the Jambudvīpa continent are medicines for long life.'

source_sentence: 諸末尼寶能與有情所求眾藥。
translation: Those maṇi-jewels are able to provide sentient beings with the medicines they seek.
They naturally produce beautiful, excellent food.
There are also many different kinds of fragrant trees.
There's the wonderful sandalwood tree and the agaru tree.
It's a submerged red sandalwood tree with large, everlasting leaves and flowers.
It's a variety of trees, including the intoxicating scent.

source_sentence: 可樂妙香無攝無受諸如意樹。
translation: The pleasant, wonderful fragrance, lack of inclusion, and lack of sensation are all wishing trees.
There are all kinds of different kinds in the ocean.
Those are the maṇi-jeweled, wish-granting pearls.
There's Sumeru, Mount Aśvakarṇa, and Mount Ghositā.
Gandhāra, Gandhāra, and Maṇḍala.
(Mt. Indra), the great mountain.
Mt. Mandāra, Mt. Vajra, and so forth.
There are all kinds of jeweled peaks on those great mountains.
They're jeweled platforms, precious stones, jeweled caves, and jeweled palaces.
Jeweled jewels, jeweled tablets, and many jeweled stairways.
The maṇi pillars, jeweled lamp wheels, and so forth.
The beryl and other maṇi types.
There are all the heavenly palaces of the lordless gods.
The gods' famous flowers are a delight to behold.
The gods are filled with instruments of music that are blown by the gentle breeze.
Their empty palaces are ringing with the beautiful sounds of rows and tributes.

source_sentence: 天諸音樂不鼓自然出美妙聲。
translation: The gods' music and sounds naturally produce beautiful sounds without drumming.
The gods are filled with birds living in empty mansions.

source_sentence: 鳴妙音聲并諸寶雲出大美聲。
translation: They make a wonderful sound and the clouds of treasures produce a great, beautiful sound.
The gods' maṇi sing songs and music.

source_sentence: 并諸妙香花樹鬘樹塗香燒香樹。
translation: And there are wonderful incense trees, flowering trees, garland trees, perfume trees, and incense-burning trees.
There are lamp trees, banner trees, banner trees, and jeweled trees.
There's nothing to take in from all of these.
They're offered to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.
They are all visible to the Buddha's eye.
There are great clouds of offerings in all the buddha bases.
There are clouds of flowers, clouds of incense, clouds of garlands, clouds of burning incense, and clouds of smeared incense.

source_sentence: 塗香雲寶蓋雲寶幢雲寶幡雲。
translation: There are clouds of smeared incense, clouds of jeweled canopies, clouds of jeweled banners, and clouds of jeweled robes, clouds of jeweled clusters, and clouds of jeweled vessels.

source_sentence: 寶衣雲寶聚雲寶器雲大末尼聚雲。
translation: There are clouds of jeweled robes, clouds of jeweled containers, and clouds of great maṇi clusters.
There are various subtle clouds of great precious jewels.
He also fills a large lantern with scented oil.
It measures the same thousand worlds and burns them with a single wick.
Measure a hundred Sumeru sticks.

source_sentence: 奉施一切諸佛世尊諸大菩薩。
translation: They gave offerings to all the buddhas, world-honored ones, and great bodhisattvas.
This offering produces excellent fortune.
They will also dedicate their lives to unsurpassed bodhi.
It's like the good qualities cultivated by past Buddhas.
This is the method of doing so because it's unobtainable.
I'll dedicate myself to enlightenment.
I'll likewise maintain this merit.
I'll dedicate it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
I urge the buddhas.
May I simply go to the site of the path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 降伏魔怨證大菩提轉大法輪。
translation: He'll subdue Māra and realize great enlightenment, turning the great wheel of the Dharma.
Those who want to extinguish [evil] will do so for all sentient beings.
I urge them to vow to abide for a great eon.

source_sentence: 隨喜一切諸佛菩薩一切有情所修諸福。
translation: Follow the joy of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and all the merits cultivated by sentient beings.
He reveals and repents of all his sins.

source_sentence: 猶如三世諸佛菩薩懺悔罪障。
translation: It's like the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the three times who repent of their sins and hindrances.
I too thus wish for the cessation of sins.
After bestowing gifts and even repenting them, I'll finish.

source_sentence: 即以淨心憶念一切諸佛菩薩。
translation: That's when he recalls all the buddhas and bodhisattvas with a pure mind.

source_sentence: 對佛像前誦此密言滿足八遍密言曰。
translation: He recites this secret formula in front of the Buddha's image and fulfills it eight times, saying.

source_sentence: 唵娑頗(二合)羅裟頗(二合)羅微摩那娑(去引)囉摩訶(引)若縛吽誦密言已。
translation: "Om svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa svabhāsa.
He then even follows his desires.
He accomplishes the cloud of the great, marvelous offerings of the gods.
He'll attain the appearance of all buddha-places.
Suppose a good man or woman fixes his or her thoughts on the Buddha, whether it's daytime or nighttime.
fix their thoughts on the Buddha, whether by day or night.
He recites the great dedication of merit like this.
That good man or good woman ...

source_sentence: 諸罪銷滅一切煩惱漸得微薄。
translation: His or her sins are extinguished, and all his or her afflictions gradually become less and less severe.
He or she will attain the merits described above.
If he recites it once, he'll attain the merit of a hundred purity virtues.
He or she will see the Buddha in their dreams.
After their life ends, they'll be born in the Pure Land.

source_sentence: 佛說是經已諸菩薩眾歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the bodhisattvas rejoiced and handed it down.
Foshuo xiangxun jing
